benchmark_details.name: RealBench
benchmark_details.overview: RealBench is the first benchmark aimed at real-world IP-level Verilog generation tasks, featuring complex, structured designs from open-source IPs, multi-modal and formatted design specifications, and rigorous verification environments.
benchmark_details.data_type: Verilog design specifications and Verilog code

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark LLMsâ€™ Verilog generation capability in real-world design workflows and facilitate advancements in hardware design automation.

data.source: Real-world open-source IP designs including AES encoder/decoder cores and an SD card controller.
data.annotation: Manually written specifications ensuring completeness and clarity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics like func@1 and formal@1 are used to evaluate the correctness of generated Verilog code.
methodology.interpretation: Pass rates indicate the correctness of generated modules, with higher rates reflecting successful generation.
methodology.validation: Validation through rigorous testbench and formal verification processes to ensure quality.
